page.title: 09Wytham: the Parish Registers
page.content: We went to the Central Library in Oxford to look for all sorts of information on Wytham. Of course, the book I used was a copy of the real parish registers. They are in the Bodleian library. I looked at the facts for the last 10 years. There had been 8 deaths, 11 marriages, and 19 baptisms in that time. The oldest person to be mentioned was a woman called Dora Jarrett. She lived to be 95 - a good old age! Of the people who were married in Wytham Church, 6 couples lived in the village, and 5 marriages had been between people from elsewhere. Of the baptisms, or christenings recorded, 8 had been of local babies. Looking back, there had been more deaths and marriages, but fewer baptisms in a period of little change. The coming of new families might affect this.
